citeinfo.title: FishBase: A Global Information System on Fishes

abstract.p: FishBase, a global information system on the biology of fish with information to cater to different professionals such as research scientists, fisheries managers, zoologists and many more. FishBase on the web contains practically all fish species known to science. It contains 29100 species, 210400 common names, 40500 pictures, and 37400 references.
FishBase is available on CD-ROM, with detailed information on population dynamics, genetics, morphology, tropic ecology, physiology, ecotoxicology, reproduction, etc.
[Reference: Froese, R. and D. Pauly. Editors. 2005.FishBase. World Wide Web electronic publication. www.fishbase.org, version (10/2005).]

descript.purpose: FishBase was developed at the WorldFish Center (http://www.worldfishcenter.org) in collaboration with the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) and many other partners, and with support from the European Commission (EC).

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
